meanings.definition: The quality or state of being maleficent; evil-doing.
meanings.sent1: The maleficences of the villain were evident in his cruel actions.
meanings.sent2: The town was plagued by the maleficences of the wicked sorcerer.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show portrayed the maleficences of the clumsy magician in a humorous light.
meanings.sent4: The maleficences of the corrupt politician cast a dark shadow over the city.
meanings.sent5: The maleficences of the haunted house made it a place to avoid at all costs.

meanings.definition: An evil deed or action; wrongdoing.
meanings.sent1: The maleficences committed by the thief left a trail of destruction.
meanings.sent2: The maleficences of the criminal were finally brought to light by the detective.
meanings.sent3: The children's book warned about the consequences of maleficences through a cautionary tale.
meanings.sent4: The maleficences of the storm wreaked havoc on the small village.
meanings.sent5: The maleficences of the dark wizard were legendary in the realm.
